results.title: The Big Dry
results.brief_description: The 1982-83 drought in North- west Victoria and South Australia impacted heavily on the environment. This tape examines the effect of the drought in the Mallee region in terms of soil conservation. This area experienced severe soil erosion as farmers were forced to overgraze livestock, in particular sheep.
results.description: The 1982-83 drought in North- west Victoria and South Australia impacted heavily on the environment. results.title: 'Riff Raff the re-mix'
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Ivan Gaal and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Kids for kids”.
Riff-Raff, an Australian rock musical that launched the well known band “Men at Work” was re-staged at the Union Theatre, University of Melbourne. The musical touches upon the problems, frustrations and hopes of four teenagers living in the ‘80’s. It featured two Year 12 students who were involved in a professional performance for the first time and they discuss how they benefited from the experience. Contains interviews with the writer/director of the musical, Jan McDonald and writer/actor, Phil Sumner.

results.title: Computers as work aids in transport; Impact of computers in local government

video_links.name: Computers as work aids in transport; Impact of computers in local government

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Computers”.
A compilation of two programs which examine the role of computers at work: 1. Computers as work aids in transport (16 min). - 2. Impact of computers in local government (16 min).

results.title: Changing Times - Changing Schools: Establishing Victorian Secondary Colleges
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal, Warren Thomas and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Educational administrators, teachers, parents and students comment on a range of re-organisation arrangements developed to enable Victorian secondary schools to better respond to todays workforce requirements and the needs of young adults in schooling.

results.title: Creative Activity: Our First Puppet Play
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday, Jean Halliday and Australian Instructional Films

video_links.name: Creative Activity: Our First Puppet Play

results.brief_description: A classroom film describing the steps in the production of a puppet play by primary school children. Shows the various stages in production: planning of story and action; choosing puppets; making props and backdrop; preparing stage; allotting parts; rehearsing; finally, the finished puppet show.

results.title: Computing History: Teaching With a New Technology
results.creator_credit: David Tiley, Penny Robins, Video Projects and Commonwealth Schools Commission (Australia)
results.brief_description: Looks at the use of computers as word-processors and databases in the teaching of history. Programs such as database, newsroom and open database are shown being used. The program also highlights some of the problems, and some of the advantages of using this approach to the teaching of history.

results.title: The 1956 Olympic story [Winter Olympics in Cortina, Italy]
results.creator_credit: Norman Mackay, Harry Leaman and Helms Athletic Foundation

video_links.name: The 1956 Olympic story [Winter Olympics in Cortina, Italy]

results.brief_description: Documentary film on the Olympic Winter Games in Cortina in the Italian Alps, 1956. Sets the panoramic views of Cortina and the venues where the 1956 Winter games will be held whilst highlighting the previous 1952 Oslo Winter games with footage of specific events. Also includes footage of Melbourne in 1956 featuring the Melbourne Cricket Ground and St Kilda Town Hall and images of the 1952 Summer games in Helsinki. Narrated by Fred Hessler.
results.title_for_label: The 1956 Olympic story [Winter Olympics in Cortina, Italy]
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman Mackay, Harry Leaman and Helms Athletic Foundation

results.title: Autumn days
results.brief_description: Shows without commentary some of the special features of autumn and how people prepare themselves for the cold weather ahead. It covers typical autumn activities, the turning of the leaves, harvesting of apples, and autumn in the country. Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: A Changing Perspective
results.brief_description: This film covers the widening interests of the Australian Paper Mills company. An historical background is given and the present main interests of the company, forestry, paper and pulp are documented. New projects include a diverse range of activities such as paper, plastic and metal packaging
